Sraracha is a pet dropped by Sarachnis, and is a much smaller version of the boss. Players can right click Metamorphosis to change its form, providing they have used an orange or blue egg sac to unlock its other coloured forms.

When a player receives the pet, it will automatically try to appear as their follower. At the same time, a red message in the chatbox will state You have a funny feeling like you're being followed.

However, if a player receives a pet while having a follower out (for example, a cat), it will be placed into their inventory. When this occurs, the message in the chatbox will instead state You feel something weird sneaking into your backpack. If a players inventory is full and they have a follower already, they will not receive the pet.

On death, if a player loses their pet (as a follower or in your inventory) it will wander around for 30 seconds before disappearing completely.

Players can pay a one-time fee of 500,000 coins to Probita in East Ardougne to have this pet insured. Should the pet be lost while insured, it can be reclaimed for 1,000,000 coins.

Dialogue[edit | edit source]

Click here for the transcript.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
30 June 2021
(update | poll)

Coloured egg sacs from the Grubby Chest can now be used to recolour Sraracha to resemble the Spawns of Sarachnis.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The pet's name is a play on Sriracha sauce,[1] a popular type of hot sauce or chilli sauce made from a paste of chilli peppers, distilled vinegar, garlic, sugar and salt.
  • If a player uses a newspaper on Sraracha, she will exclaim "Don't you dare!", which is a cliché method of killing a spider in real life.
    • Furthermore, when examining Sarachnis, the text will say, "I'm going to need a really big newspaper..."
  • The pet's standard dialogue is a reference to the Announcer lines for the Zerg Faction in the real-time strategy game StarCraft.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Roq's Twitter account. 6 July 2019. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Roq: "[Sraracha is] based off the name of the hot sauce."

'''Sraracha''' is a pet dropped by [[Sarachnis]], and is a much smaller version of the boss. Players can right click ''Metamorphosis'' to change its form, providing they have used an [[Orange egg sac|orange]] or [[blue egg sac]] to unlock its other coloured forms.

When a player receives the pet, it will automatically try to appear as their follower. At the same time, a red message in the [[Chat Interface|chatbox]] will state {{Colour|#ef1020|You have a funny feeling like you're being followed.}}

However, if a player receives a pet while having a follower out (for example, a [[cat]]), it will be placed into their [[inventory]]. When this occurs, the message in the chatbox will instead state {{Colour|#ef1020|You feel something weird sneaking into your backpack.}} If a players inventory is full '''and''' they have a follower already, they '''will not''' receive the pet.

On death, if a player loses their pet (as a follower or in your inventory) it will wander around for 30 seconds before disappearing completely.

Players can pay a one-time fee of 500,000 [[coins]] to [[Probita]] in [[East Ardougne]] to have this pet insured. Should the pet be lost while insured, it can be reclaimed for 1,000,000 [[coins]].

==Trivia==
*The pet's name is a play on {{WP|Sriracha sauce}},{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Roq|url=https://twitter.com/JagexRoq/status/1147526365232717824|date=6 July 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/veSdV|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=[Sraracha is] based off the name of the hot sauce.}} a popular type of hot sauce or chilli sauce made from a paste of chilli peppers, distilled vinegar, garlic, sugar and salt.
*If a player uses a [[newspaper]] on Sraracha, she will exclaim "Don't you dare!", which is a cliché method of killing a spider in real life.
**Furthermore, when examining Sarachnis, the text will say, "I'm going to need a really big newspaper..."
*The pet's standard dialogue is a reference to the Announcer lines for the Zerg Faction in the real-time strategy game StarCraft.
